trails.name: Route of the Cahorros
trails.description: A spectacular route that combines hanging bridges, waterfalls, and narrow gorges. Ideal for a half-day adventure. Not suitable for people with vertigo.

reviews.author: Laura Gómez
reviews.comment: An incredible experience, the guides convey a lot of security and the group atmosphere is very welcoming. Ideal for getting started in hiking and meeting new people.

reviews.author: Carlos Martín
reviews.comment: The routes are well organized, although sometimes they get a bit long for beginners. I would have liked more breaks to rest.

trails.name: Vereda de la Estrella
trails.imageHint: Path next to a river in the mountains
trails.description: One of the most emblematic routes of the Sierra Nevada. It follows old mining trails, offering spectacular views of the north faces of Mulhacén and Veleta.

reviews.author: Ana Rodríguez
reviews.comment: Excellent club, very responsible with mountain safety. You can feel the passion for nature. I will definitely repeat on the next outing.

reviews.author: Miguel Torres
reviews.comment: The route was beautiful but there were too many people on the excursion and that made the pace difficult. It would be better to limit the groups a bit.

trails.name: Ascent to Veleta from Hoya de la Mora
trails.imageHint: Hiker on a summit with snow
trails.description: The classic ascent to one of the highest peaks on the Iberian Peninsula. The route runs along a road and path, offering unforgettable panoramic views.

reviews.author: Sofía Hernández
reviews.comment: Great variety of routes, from easy to high mountain. The organizers are always attentive to all the details. Highly recommended for anyone looking to learn and enjoy.

trails.name: Río Verde Canyon
trails.description: An aquatic adventure that combines jumps into pools, slides, and rappelling in a stunning natural environment. Perfect for escaping the summer heat. Requires specific equipment.

trails.name: Lavaderos de la Reina
trails.imageHint: Waterfalls and streams in a glacial valley
trails.description: A beautiful route that runs through a glacial valley where waterfalls and streams are born from the thaw, creating a unique landscape. Especially recommended in early summer.

reviews.author: David López
reviews.comment: I liked the walk, although I expected a little more cultural information about the area. Even so, the group was very pleasant and the landscapes spectacular.

trails.name: Dehesa del Camarate
trails.description: Known as the 'Enchanted Forest' of Andalusia, this place is a spectacle of colors in autumn. An easy route, ideal for families and photography lovers.
